summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from March to July 2019 between Assistant U.S. Attorneys and their supervisor, Edward Tyrrell, requesting and receiving approval for travel to Florida (West Palm Beach, Fort Lauderdale) and Los Angeles to conduct victim interviews as part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein (United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618). It reveals the active, multi-location victim outreach by the SDNY prosecution team in the months leading up to Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.role: Supervisor (likely Chief or Supervisor in the U.S. Attorney's Office)
persons.context: The recipient of multiple travel approval requests from prosecutors; he grants approval for their trips to interview victims in the Epstein case.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on the travel approval request emails, indicating she is part of the prosecution team working on the Epstein investigation.

connections.description: Tyrrell is the supervisor approving travel requests from Duncan and other AUSAs for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Initial Travel Request for Florida Interviews
events.description: Prosecutors request approval to travel to West Palm Beach and/or Fort Lauderdale, Florida, for two days of meetings and interviews related to the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Travel Approval for West Palm Beach
events.description: Edward Tyrrell approves a travel request for prosecutors to spend approximately three days in West Palm Beach, Florida, for meetings and interviews with victims.

events.title: Follow-up Travel to West Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors request approval for another approximately three-day trip to West Palm Beach for victim interviews, noting the need to pin down timing with victims.

events.title: Travel Request for Los Angeles Interview
events.description: Prosecutors request permission to travel to Los Angeles for a victim interview, planning to fly down on a Wednesday and return by Friday.

events.title: Travel Request for Fort Lauderdale Interview
events.description: Prosecutors request same-day travel approval to Fort Lauderdale to interview a victim who has recently come forward.

keyFacts: The document references the federal case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618,' described as an investigation relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.
It shows the Southern District of New York (SDNY) prosecution team was actively traveling to multiple locations (Florida and California) to interview victims from March to July 2019.
The emails indicate victim interviews were sometimes conducted in hotel conference rooms reserved for that purpose.
The travel was approved by supervisor Edward Tyrrell, demonstrating the institutional support and resource allocation for the investigation.
A victim is noted as having 'recently come forward' in July 2019, indicating ongoing victim outreach by prosecutors.
